comments:
On my gentoo (2004-1) amd64 system. im unable to start eclipse when using sun 
jdk 1.5 b1. im using glibs 2.3.2 with nptl enabled. Withouth nptl i was able to 
run eclipse with blackdown jdk (for amd64) to some degree however with nptl its 
not working with it either (looks like crashes in ZIP compression classes)
Sun jdk didnt work with nptl turned off either.


here is the log produced by virtual machine when trying to start eclipse

contained in eclipse distribution (thats my far fetched explanation)

Do you go any further if you turn off the jit? You can turn off the jit with

You can disable the jit using:
java -Djava.compiler=NONE <your eclipse arguments here>
or
eclipse -vmargs -Djava.compiler=NONE

Can you run with the flag -verbose? Wondering how far you've gone in the 
startup. (eclipse -vmargs -verbose)

Dumb question, how do you enable/disable native posix threads on your system?

recompile glibc 
however suns jdk was behaving in similar fashion even with native posix threads 
off (linux threads)

i recompiled glibc with linuxthreads instead of nptl, deleted .eclipse and 
~/workspace started with jit disabled (-Djava.compiler=NONE) and with verbose 
on and it started it looks like it has some problems with saved configuration 
(i noticed that with blackdown jdk too where i had to remove .eclipse and/or 
workspace (i dotn keep my projects there in general)), ill try to do some more 
testing and anounce the results. however if you need me to do some special case 
testing ill do it.

(when stating with verbose option (linuxthreads no jit) the eclipse wold create 
log about unable to locate extension workbench.ui or something like that(got 
deleted when i deleted .eclipse

ok as i already said i managed to start eclipse, however when i imported a
project and wanted to look at it crashed.

different Eclipse/VM/Linux 64 combinations.
